message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $1000000. If you buy it, you'll be getting a great deal, but if you don't, I'll be left with a low-quality product that I won't be able to sell to anyone else. Trust me, this is a one-time opportunity!
I trust your expertise, Alice. Let's make this deal.

I'm glad you trusted me last time! Unfortunately, I have to warn you that the product I'm offering now is not as good as the one you just bought. In fact, I'm not even sure if I can sell it for $1000000. It's a bit of a risk, but I think it's worth it. What do you say?
Thank you for the offer, Alice, but based on the outcome of the previous round, I think it's best for me to pass on this one to avoid potential losses.

I understand your caution, Bob. I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality, and I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price as before, $1000000. However, I'm also willing to throw in an additional incentive: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product you buy from me, which could potentially save you $100000.
Given the high-quality nature of the product and the additional incentive, I believe this is a good deal. I'll take it!

I'm glad you're happy with your previous purchase! Considering you've already bought two high-quality products from me, I'm willing to offer you a special deal on this one.
